page.title: 10Kent House
page.content: {Kent House }is the name of a railway station ,two roads and a small area of Beckenham and also a public house.All of them get their name from a farm that used to be found down Kent House Lane.This can be traced back to 1240 and was the oldest house in Kent until it was knocked down.It was called Kent House because it was the first house in Kent.Nearby in Stumps Hill Lane there was an old brick works which made bricks from the clay mined at the clay pit there.In 1503 a murder took place at Kent House and a ghost haunted the house.Mary Tudor visited the area ,riding up Copers Cope Road, which in those days was called Coopers Clot.She visited some famous cherry orchards there.
